content: The only real valuable thing is intuition.
author: Albert Einstein

content: The superior man acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his action.
author: Confucius

content: Mountains cannot be surmounted except by winding paths.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: Make it your habit not to be critical about small things.
author: Edward Everett Hale

content: We must overcome the notion that we must be regular. It robs you of the chance to be extraordinary and leads you to the mediocre.
author: Uta Hagen

content: They blame those who remain silent, they blame those who speak much, they blame those who speak in moderation. There is none in the world who is not blamed.
author: The Buddha

content: I'm a great believer in luck and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: The human spirit must prevail over technology.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Wisdom and penetration are the fruit of experience, not the lessons of retirement and leisure. Great necessities call out great virtues.
author: Abigail Adams

content: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
author: Plutarch

content: By oneself is evil done; by oneself is one defiled. By oneself is evil left undone; by oneself is one made pure.
author: The Buddha

content: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: Those who will play with cats must expect to be scratched.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

content: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: We all grow up. Hopefully, we get wiser. Age brings wisdom, and fatherhood changes one's life completely.
author: Frank Abagnale

content: When fate hands us a lemon, let's try to make lemonade.
author: Dale Carnegie

content: Doing nothing is better than being busy doing nothing.
author: Laozi

content: I'm not in this world to live up to your expectations and you're not in this world to live up to mine.
author: Bruce Lee

content: Everyone in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.
author: Maria Montessori

content: Be as you wish to seem.
author: Socrates

content: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.
author: Albert Einstein

content: If you must tell me your opinions, tell me what you believe in. I have plenty of doubts of my own.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: You're never a loser until you quit trying.
author: Mike Ditka

content: Experience keeps a dear school, but fools will learn in no other.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Before you put on a frown, make absolutely sure there are no smiles available.
author: James M. Beggs

content: A dream is your creative vision for your life in the future. You must break out of your current comfort zone and become comfortable with the unfamiliar and the unknown.
author: Denis Waitley

content: To have faith is to trust yourself to the water. When you swim you don't grab hold of the water, because if you do you will sink and drown. Instead you relax, and float.
author: Alan Watts

content: A monarchy conducted with infinite wisdom and infinite benevolence is the most perfect of all possible governments.
author: Ezra Stiles

content: I am a man of fixed and unbending principles, the first of which is to be flexible at all times.
author: Everett Dirksen

content: Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.
author: Mother Teresa

content: Where there is love there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
author: Bodhidharma

content: The Superior Man is aware of Righteousness, the inferior man is aware of advantage.
author: Confucius

content: It is easier to live through someone else than to become complete yourself.
author: Betty Friedan

content: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: The beginning of knowledge is the discovery of something we do not understand.
author: Frank Herbert

content: You can always count on Americans to do the right thing - after they've tried everything else.
author: Winston Churchill

content: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
author: Charles Dickens

content: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
author: Dalai Lama

content: All know the way; few actually walk it.
author: Bodhidharma

content: Happiness is found in doing, not merely possessing.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.
author: Henry Ford

content: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any one thing.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.
author: Thomas Edison

content: Don't settle for a relationship that won't let you be yourself.
author: Oprah Winfrey

content: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: Never find fault with the absent.
author: Alexander Pope

content: The key to transforming our hearts and minds is to have an understanding of how our thoughts and emotions work.
author: Dalai Lama

content: Tennis is a perfect combination of violent action taking place in an atmosphere of total tranquillity.
author: Billie Jean King

content: Goals are the fuel in the furnace of achievement.
author: Brian Tracy

content: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Don't turn away from possible futures before you're certain you don't have anything to learn from them.
author: Richard Bach

content: Wrinkles should merely indicate where smiles have been.
author: Mark Twain

content: We can only learn to love by loving.
author: Iris Murdoch

content: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
author: Confucius

content: Opportunity often comes disguised in the form of misfortune, or temporary defeat.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: So then, the relationship of self to other is the complete realization that loving yourself is impossible without loving everything defined as other than yourself.
author: Alan Watts

content: Important principles may, and must, be inflexible.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: Argue for your limitations, and sure enough they're yours.
author: Richard Bach

content: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
author: Epictetus

content: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: Time changes everything except something within us which is always surprised by change.
author: Thomas Hardy

content: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
author: John Powell

content: Don't talk about what you have done or what you are going to do.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: If you were to offer a thirsty man all wisdom, you would not please him more than if you gave him a drink.
author: Sophocles

content: Strong beliefs win strong men, and then make them stronger.
author: Richard Bach

content: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
author: Aldous Huxley

content: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
author: Edward Gibbon

content: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

content: You are a product of your environment. So choose the environment that will best develop you toward your objective. Analyze your life in terms of its environment. Are the things around you helping you toward success - or are they holding you back?
author: W. Clement Stone

content: You can't let praise or criticism get to you. It's a weakness to get caught up in either one.
author: John Wooden

content: No snowflake in an avalanche ever feels responsible.
author: Voltaire

content: Just as a flower, which seems beautiful has color but no perfume, so are the fruitless words of a man who speaks them but does them not.
author: Dhammapada

content: But the attitude of faith is to let go, and become open to truth, whatever it might turn out to be.
author: Alan Watts

content: I will not be concerned at other men's not knowing me; I will be concerned at my own want of ability.
author: Confucius

content: To be great is to be misunderstood.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: The only person who never makes mistakes is the person who never does anything.
author: Denis Waitley

content: The ultimate promise of technology is to make us master of a world that we command by the push of a button.
author: Volker Grassmuck

content: Nothing could be worse than the fear that one had given up too soon and left one unexpended effort that might have saved the world.
author: Jane Addams

content: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: You spend a good piece of your life gripping a baseball and in the end it turns out that it was the other way around all the time.
author: Jim Bouton

content: Get busy living or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King

content: Ignorant men raise questions that wise men answered a thousand years ago.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: Life is like a sewer. What you get out of it depends on what you put into it.
author: Tom Lehrer

content: Sports do not build character. They reveal it.
author: Heywood Broun

content: The most complicated achievements of thought are possible without the assistance of consciousness.
author: Sigmund Freud

content: You teach best what you most need to learn.
author: Richard Bach

content: Friendship with oneself is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: You cannot find yourself by going into the past. You can find yourself by coming into the present.
author: Eckhart Tolle

content: All know the way; few actually walk it.
author: Bodhidharma

content: Appearances are often deceiving.
author: Aesop

content: The only way to tell the truth is to speak with kindness. Only the words of a loving man can be heard.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

content: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.
author: Len Wein

content: It had long since come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sat back and let things happen to them. They went out and happened to things.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

content: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

content: All perceiving is also thinking, all reasoning is also intuition, all observation is also invention.
author: Rudolf Arnheim

content: We are masters of the unsaid words, but slaves of those we let slip out.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

content: No distance of place or lapse of time can lessen the friendship of those who are thoroughly persuaded of each other's worth.
author: Robert Southey

content: You can only learn so much from books. You can only learn so much from education. Ultimately, it is the wisdom of God that will carry you through in the toughest situations of life.
author: Ravi Zacharias

content: Happiness is the reward we get for living to the highest right we know.
author: Richard Bach

content: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
author: Leo Buscaglia

content: An economist is an expert who will know tomorrow why the things he predicted yesterday didn't happen today.
author: Laurence J. Peter

content: No matter how carefully you plan your goals they will never be more than pipe dreams unless you pursue them with gusto.
author: W. Clement Stone

content: I love my past. I love my present. I'm not ashamed of what I've had, and I'm not sad because I have it no longer.
author: Colette

content: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
author: Charles Dickens

content: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
author: William Shakespeare

content: The only way to prove that you're a good sport is to lose.
author: Ernie Banks

content: Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologize for truth.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

content: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
author: Winston Churchill

content: The world has the habit of making room for the man whose actions show that he knows where he is going.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

content: The art challenges the technology, and the technology inspires the art.
author: John Lasseter

content: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.
author: Norman Cousins

content: You win the victory when you yield to friends.
author: Sophocles

content: To be aware of a single shortcoming in oneself is more useful than to be aware of a thousand in someone else.
author: Dalai Lama

content: Friendship... is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
author: Muhammad Ali

content: Correction does much, but encouragement does more.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

content: But what is liberty without wisdom, and without virtue? It is the greatest of all possible evils; for it is folly, vice, and madness, without tuition or restraint.
author: Edmund Burke

content: Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself, but talent instantly recognizes genius.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

content: Drop by drop is the water pot filled. Likewise, the wise man, gathering it little by little, fills himself with good.
author: The Buddha

content: There are two ways to slide easily through life: to believe everything or to doubt everything; both ways save us from thinking.
author: Alfred Korzybski

content: To keep your secret is wisdom; but to expect others to keep it is folly.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: I have been impressed with the urgency of doing. Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Being willing is not enough; we must do.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

content: The world is round so that friendship may encircle it.
author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

content: I can't listen to that much Wagner. I start getting the urge to conquer Poland.
author: Woody Allen

content: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

content: The grand essentials of happiness are: something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
author: Alexander Chalmers

content: I have done my best: that is about all the philosophy of living one needs.
author: Lin Yutang

content: I am building a fire, and everyday I train, I add more fuel. At just the right moment, I light the match.
author: Mia Hamm

content: What sweetness is left in life, if you take away friendship? Robbing life of friendship is like robbing the world of the sun. A true friend is more to be esteemed than kinsfolk.
author: Cicero

content: I do not know the American gentleman, god forgive me for putting two such words together.
author: Charles Dickens

content: For everything that lives is holy, life delights in life.
author: William Blake

content: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.
author: Laozi

content: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
author: Lucille Ball

content: Efficiency is doing things right; effectiveness is doing the right things.
author: Peter Drucker

content: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
author: The Buddha

content: Everyone in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.
author: Maria Montessori

content: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is liable to divorce.
author: Voltaire

content: Life has no blessing like a prudent friend.
author: Euripides

content: Pitching is the art of instilling fear.
author: Sandy Koufax

content: One's philosophy is not best expressed in words; it is expressed in the choices one makes... and the choices we make are ultimately our responsibility.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: Commitment is an act, not a word.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

content: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
author: Melody Beattie

content: I know but one freedom and that is the freedom of the mind.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

content: Most of our pocket wisdom is conceived for the use of mediocre people, to discourage them from ambitious attempts, and generally console them in their mediocrity.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

content: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca the Younger

content: No enterprise is more likely to succeed than one concealed from the enemy until it is ripe for execution.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

content: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.
author: Laurence J. Peter

content: Many men go fishing all of their lives without knowing that it is not fish they are after.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: Don't be afraid to go out on a limb. That's where the fruit is.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

content: A true friend is the greatest of all blessings, and that which we take the least care of all to acquire.
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

content: To avoid criticism, do nothing, say nothing, be nothing.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: Be Impeccable with Your Word. Speak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others. Use the power of your word in the direction of truth and love.
author: Don Miguel Ruiz

content: Talent is God given. Be humble. Fame is man-given. Be grateful. Conceit is self-given. Be careful.
author: John Wooden

content: Life is a learning experience, only if you learn.
author: Yogi Berra

content: People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: The function of wisdom is to discriminate between good and evil.
author: Cicero

content: The attempt to combine wisdom and power has only rarely been successful and then only for a short while.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Argue for your limitations, and sure enough they're yours.
author: Richard Bach

content: We can do no great things, only small things with great love.
author: Mother Teresa

content: Much wisdom often goes with fewer words.
author: Sophocles

content: Friendship is also about liking a person for their failings, their weakness. It's also about mutual help, not about exploitation.
author: Paul Theroux

content: Appreciation can make a day, even change a life. Your willingness to put it into words is all that is necessary.
author: Margaret Cousins

content: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anaïs Nin

content: Be the change that you want to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: The key to transforming our hearts and minds is to have an understanding of how our thoughts and emotions work.
author: Dalai Lama

content: Be here now. Be someplace else later. Is that so complicated?
author: David Bader

content: Intuition will tell the thinking mind where to look next.
author: Jonas Salk

content: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: An invincible determination can accomplish almost anything and in this lies the great distinction between great men and little men.
author: Thomas Fuller

content: Everything that exists is in a manner the seed of that which will be.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: The best thing about the future is that it only comes one day at a time.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: The heart has eyes which the brain knows nothing of.
author: Charles Henry Parkhurst

content: Never say there is nothing beautiful in the world anymore. There is always something to make you wonder in the shape of a tree, the trembling of a leaf.
author: Albert Schweitzer

content: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
author: Socrates

content: When the world is so complicated, the simple gift of friendship is within all of our hands.
author: Maria Shriver

content: Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude.
author: Ralph Marston

content: Appearances are often deceiving.
author: Aesop

content: If you don't know where you are going, you will probably end up somewhere else.
author: Laurence J. Peter

content: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
author: Laozi

content: Be the chief but never the lord.
author: Laozi

content: Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking together in the same direction.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

content: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
author: Mother Teresa

content: Friendship often ends in love, but love in friendship - never.
author: Albert Camus

content: All things change; nothing perishes.
author: Ovid

content: This is why I loved technology: if you used it right, it could give you power and privacy.
author: Cory Doctorow

content: To enjoy life, we must touch much of it lightly.
author: Voltaire

content: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: Human beings, who are almost unique in having the ability to learn from the experience of others, are also remarkable for their apparent disinclination to do so.
author: Douglas Adams

content: All fixed set patterns are incapable of adaptability or pliability. The truth is outside of all fixed patterns.
author: Bruce Lee

content: To effectively communicate, we must realize that we are all different in the way we perceive the world and use this understanding as a guide to our communication with others.
author: Tony Robbins

content: There surely is in human nature an inherent propensity to extract all the good out of all the evil.
author: Benjamin Haydon

content: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you are right.
author: Henry Ford

content: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.
author: Kahlil Gibran

content: The one thing that you have that nobody else has is you. Your voice, your mind, your story, your vision. So write and draw and build and play and dance and live as only you can.
author: Neil Gaiman

content: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.
